author: W. Chapman

review: A lot of reviews on here seem to think that this device is for general streaming from stored video to your TV.That's not what it's for.It's for streaming internet video onto your TV.  Youtube, Netflix, and the like.  And for that, it works great.  Yes, this functionality exists in other devices, but I've never found one that's nearly as easy to set up or use as the Chromecast, and you aren't hampered by the absolutely terrible interfaces that are on most of the other device-based Netflix and YouTube players.I have also found that it does in fact work reasonably well to stream material from my desktop computer, through the Chrome browser plugin. A trick that I've found to work well on Linux is to, instead of opening from a regular file, open a named pipe (mkfifo test.avi) and then have VLC transcode to that file. This lets you play files with soft subtitles and so on, though it does require a bit of setup.

author: Tonya L. Ware

review: I own 3 Chromecasts and gifted 2 more. Everyone should own a Chromecast. If someone has a TV and has a smartphone- the choice is obvious.So about the Chromecast, it's a solid little dongle that plugs to the back of your HDTV (with an additional USB power connection also for most TV's). Setup is really basic- I gifted my parents one, and they are least familiar with technology in the whole family... They were able to get it setup by themselves by just following the on-screen and paper instructions.Uses for the Chromecast are mostly:For parties- My friends are already logged on my wifi when they come for parties, and there is no setup for them to control my HDTV with their Android or iOS phones. We basically drink and watch random Youtubes. If not, I let it stream Pandora in the background since my sound system is linked to my HDTV.For parents- My parents watch a ton of foreign movies and shows, so they take advantage of the PC to Chromecast tab in Google Chrome (they figured it out themselves, which I was surprised). Also they cast Viki which has thousands of new foreign shows.For roommates- When you share an apartment/dorm with a friend- Chromecast is a great tool to stream movies to from either person's desktop or laptop. Make sure you have a strong wifi connection though- it hogs a ton of bandwidth.I can't stress enough how much use I get out of my Chromecast and how little people actually ever use the "built-in Smart TV" function of their Samsung, LG, Sony, etc. branded SMART TV's... Bottom line- EVERYONE can use a Chromecast & NO ONE can learn how to use 2395643654723948798 different SMART TVs.
